summary: TypeScript compilation times are slow due to large barrel imports in @temporalio/client and a massive 49k-line proto declaration file. The request is to optimize package structure with deep path imports and split proto definitions into smaller files for parallel type checking.
userImpact: Developers experience slow TypeScript compilation times (1+ second for client imports) which impacts development velocity in monorepo projects.
rootCause: Large barrel index exports and a massive 49k-line proto declaration file (root.d.ts, 2.67 MB) that must be fully parsed and type-checked sequentially instead of in parallel.
proposedFix: Remove barrel imports and use deep path imports for @temporalio/client; split root.d.ts into multiple focused files (coresdk.d.ts, temporal.d.ts, google.d.ts, grpc.d.ts) for parallel type checking.
resolutionDetails: Issue was addressed through optimization of import structure and proto file splitting to reduce type-checking burden.
keyQuote: Importing the @temporalio/client package takes 1 second... The generated file at @temporalio/proto/protos/root.d.ts is massive and is most likely consuming most of the parsing/checking time.
